required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Effect of Foot Reflexology Massage on Heart Rate Variability and Arterial Pulse Waveform
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Foot Reflexology Massage on Heart Rate Variability and Arterial Pulse Waveform After Yo Yo Intermittent Recovery Test and Repeated Sprint Test

brief_summary.textblock: Foot reflexology treatment provides acute and chronic effects on cardiovascular and hemodynamic functions. However, no information is available to us in regarding the treatment effect of foot reflexology after exercise. This study investigated the acute effect of foot reflexology treatment on heart rate variability after anaerobic-based and aerobic-based intermittent exercises.

detailed_description.textblock: The sympathetic activation and sympathy-vagal balance after repeat sprint performance can be immediately modulated by foot reflexology massage. The acute benefits of foot reflexology intervention on cardiac sympathovagal balance can be considered as exercise recovery strategies in sports.

primary_outcome.description: 15 minutes resting electrocardiographic record at baseline and post-intervention phase

secondary_outcome.description: 15 minutes resting arterial plethysmographic waveform at baseline and post-intervention phase

arm_group.description: The duration of intervention was 30 min (15 min massage duration for each leg)

intervention.description: Foot reflexology technique of Father Josef was used as massage intervention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Undertake football/futsal training at least 3 times a week
- Age between 18 and 30 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of severe neuromuscular injury
- Current lower extremity injury
- Current neurological diseases

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data is protected by IRB application with a minimum of 3 years data storage.
